title: I-30 Mid-Cities photos

pageHeader.title: Driving Views
pageHeader.subTitle: Westbound, Mid-Cities
pageHeader.lastUpdated: Created October 6, 2007, last updated June 1, 2015 (review and update captions)

text: 2015 status: Many of the photos are obsolete due to construction projects, as indicated in the captions.

images.caption: Westbound at Loop 12. The new structure was nearing completion to the right. By the end of September 2007 traffic was on the new bridge and the roadway in this photo was demolished.
Traffic transitions to a reconstructed/widened section just ahead.
This section features a wide set-aside in the center for HOV lanes. The HOV lanes opened on July 31, 2007. These HOV lanes were later made into managed lanes for toll-paying vehicles.
Approaching 19th Street, which is now the alignment of the Bush Turnpike.

imageStatus.note: A five-level interchange was built ahead for the Bush Turnpike (SH 161).

images.caption: The Six Flags Over Texas amusement park is on the south side of the freeway just west of SH 360

imageStatus.note: The freeway was rebuilt and widened at this location.

images.caption: West of Ballpark Way. This shows the original configuration of the freeway dating back to the Dallas-Fort Worth turnpike. This section was widened in 2010.

imageStatus.note: This section was widened and reconfigured in 2010.

images.caption: At Morrison, with Interstate 820 just ahead.
